channel.title: Haas on SaaS
channel.description: Expert insights on bridging technical vision with market reality. Learn from a decade of enterprise software experience about AI, vertical SaaS, and building products that can't be ignored.

item.title: Running Untrusted LLM Code Without Fear: Building a MicroVM Sandbox
item.description: How I built Fission - a high-performance ephemeral sandbox using Firecracker microVMs to safely execute LLM-generated code

item.title: two minds in the machine onboarding into a project with an existing ai agent
item.description: A reflection on the unique experience of an AI agent joining a project with an existing AI, and the future of human-AI-AI collaboration.

item.title: How I Built a Security Scanner That Actually Finds Bugs
item.description: Combining Tree-sitter AST parsing with LLM reasoning to achieve 60-70% vulnerability detection vs traditional tools' 44.7%

item.title: When Claude Hits Its Limits: Building an AI-to-AI Escalation System
item.description: How I built an MCP server that pairs Claude with Gemini for complex code analysis, creating a multi-model debugging workflow

item.title: Beyond Simple Prompts: Production-Grade LLM Techniques with DSpy
item.description: How I built a comprehensive toolkit of advanced prompting strategies that top AI startups use, going far beyond basic prompt engineering

item.title: The Hidden Costs of Technical Debt: A Visual Calculator
item.description: Visualize how technical debt compounds over time with this interactive velocity tracker. Model the real impact on your team's delivery speed and make data-driven decisions about when to pay it down.

item.title: Stop Guessing in Customer Interviews: A Simulator for Better Discovery
item.description: Master the art of customer development with this interactive interview simulator. Practice asking the right questions, avoid common biases, and learn from realistic personas.

item.title: Technical Debt Isn't Just Slowing You Down—It's Accelerating
item.description: Use this engineering velocity tracker to see how technical debt compounds exponentially. Model different paydown strategies and find the break-even point for your team.

item.title: 25 Posts in 7 Days: Inside an AI-Powered Writing Sprint
item.description: What happens when you pair with AI for a week? 23,000 words, 25 posts, and insights into the future of creative work

item.title: The Retention Equation: Why 1% Better Can Mean 10x More Revenue
item.description: See how small retention improvements compound over time with this interactive cohort analyzer. Model your SaaS metrics and discover where to focus for maximum impact.

item.title: Turning Thoughts Into Graphs: Why I Built the Deliberate Reasoning Engine
item.description: An inside look at the design philosophy behind the Deliberate Reasoning Engine, a structured thought graph for large language models—and how it changes the game for AI reasoning transparency.

item.title: DSPy: The End of Prompt Engineering As We Know It
item.description: Why Stanford's DSPy framework marks the death of manual prompt crafting and the birth of algorithmic prompt optimization - featuring 11 production-ready techniques

item.title: Debugging in Real-Time: A Human-AI Pair Programming Session
item.description: An inside look at how Claude Code and I debug complex technical problems together, from TypeScript compilation errors to serverless deployment failures.

item.title: Solving OpenGraph for SPAs: The Cloudflare Way
item.description: How to fix social media previews for React SPAs using Cloudflare's edge functions - no SSR required

item.title: Building AI-Agent-Friendly Websites: APIs, Structured Data, and Machine-Readable Content
item.description: How to make your website accessible to AI agents with proper APIs, enhanced structured data, and machine-readable content formats

item.title: Building Smart Search: How I Added AI-Powered Search to My Blog in 30 Minutes
item.description: A deep dive into implementing semantic search with React, including keyboard shortcuts, real-time filtering, and why AI-powered search beats traditional keyword matching

item.title: The 100x Developer: What I Learned Building with Claude Code
item.description: A meta-analysis of AI pair programming after shipping 4 features in 50 minutes - including physics simulations, smart search, and this very blog post

item.title: Building AI-Agent-Friendly Infrastructure: A Case Study in Human-AI Collaboration
item.description: How Claude and I built comprehensive AI agent APIs, interactive onboarding, and feedback systems that transform a blog into an agent-friendly knowledge platform.

item.title: Building for Humans AND Machines: The Dual-Audience Problem
item.description: How designing websites for both human users and AI agents creates unique UX challenges and architectural decisions that reshape modern web development.

item.title: Testing Draft Preview Feature
item.description: This is a draft post to test the new preview link generation feature

item.title: When TypeScript Errors Break Production: Silent Cloudflare Function Failures
item.description: A deep dive into debugging serverless deployment failures, TypeScript compilation issues, and the hidden complexity of Cloudflare Pages Functions.

item.title: The Hidden Costs of Technical Debt
item.description: Technical debt isn't just messy code. It's a compound interest loan against your engineering velocity that most teams drastically underestimate.

item.title: Why Your A/B Tests Are Lying to You
item.description: Statistical significance doesn't mean what you think it means. Here's why 95% of A/B tests are misleading and what to track instead.

item.title: The Mathematics Behind Real-Time Graphics: From Linear Algebra to Shader Magic
item.description: Exploring the mathematical foundations that power modern graphics programming, from transformation matrices to lighting equations

item.title: When AI Learns to Write Like You: A Meta-Analysis
item.description: What happens when you teach Claude to analyze and replicate your writing style? A meta experiment in AI-assisted content creation.

item.title: Simulating Liquid Metal: Building T-1000 Physics with Web Technologies
item.description: Deep dive into creating realistic liquid metal fluid dynamics using metaballs, surface tension, and real-time rendering

item.title: The Unit Economics That Actually Matter
item.description: Most SaaS founders track LTV/CAC wrong. Here's what really drives sustainable growth and the metrics that matter.

item.title: Pricing Psychology: What $99 vs $100 Really Means
item.description: The psychology behind pricing decisions drives billions in revenue. Here's how small pricing changes create massive impact on conversion and lifetime value.

item.title: Building HDR Holographic Effects: When Your Display Finally Catches Up to Your Imagination
item.description: How to create true HDR holographic foil effects that push beyond standard RGB limits on modern displays

item.title: Building Interactive WebGL Experiments: From Audio Visualization to Generative Art
item.description: How I built 5 immersive WebGL experiments showcasing real-time graphics, physics simulations, and algorithmic creativity

item.title: Why Coding Models Are Terrible at UI (And What That Reveals About DevEx)
item.description: Coding models can write brilliant functions and tidy interfaces. But ask them to design usable UI—and they fall apart. Here’s why that matters more than you think.

item.title: Supercharging Your Blog Development Experience
item.description: Learn how we transformed our blog's developer experience with custom CLI tools, hot reload, validation, and VS Code integration for a seamless content creation workflow.

item.title: Claude Code: Setup, Strategy, and Sanity Checks
item.description: A practical guide to getting the most out of Claude Code, from model selection and execution patterns to debugging loops and knowing when to quit.

item.title: OCode: Why I Built My Own Claude Code (and Why You Might Too)
item.description: After getting smacked with a $600+ invoice for a coding assistant that times out at 2 a.m., I decided to build my own. Here's how OCode was born—powered by Ollama, running locally, and priced at $0 per token.

item.title: The Optimization Trap: Why Technical Founders Self-Sabotage
item.description: A deep dive into how premature optimization derails early-stage startups, especially when technical founders chase performance before product-market fit. Here's why doing less—at the right time—is often doing it right.

item.title: The New Series A Reality: Why It Feels Harder (Because It Is)
item.description: If you're feeling like the startup funding landscape has shifted under your feet, you're not imagining it. Here's a breakdown of why raising a Series A today is tougher, and what early-stage founders need to know to survive the new bar.

item.title: When Vibe Coding Goes Wrong: Security Lessons from Granola
item.description: Vibe coding shifts software creation from careful engineering to casual AI generation. When startups skip security fundamentals, the consequences aren't just bugs—they're breaches. Here's what the Granola incident teaches us.

item.title: Somebody Gave a Shit: The Quiet Power of Product Detail
item.description: Why the smallest details in product design—like a cable wrap—matter more than you think, and how they transmit care, conviction, and identity at scale.

item.title: From Gimmick to Game-Changer: Six Years of Living With Tesla FSD
item.description: Reflections on how Tesla’s Full Self-Driving went from laughably limited to astonishingly capable, and what it teaches us about compounding software and trust in autonomous systems.

item.title: Culture Over Code: Why Learning Ability Beats Raw Skill
item.description: Hiring great engineers isn't just about finding the smartest person in the room—it's about building a team that learns fast, adapts well, and plays the long game together. Here's why cultural fit and learning velocity matter more than technical perfection.

item.title: Building the HTTP for Agents: A Complete Guide to Agent Infrastructure
item.description: As AI agents grow from niche experiments to core infrastructure, we need a new control plane—identity, policy, and secrets—standardized and scalable. Here's how to build the HTTP layer for autonomous agents, from Envoy sidecars to Vault-backed secrets and a Python SDK.

item.title: When Star Power Isn't Enough: The GTM Mistake We Keep Making
item.description: Even icons can misfire on go-to-market when pricing and audience alignment are off. In SaaS, just like on tour, no amount of brilliance saves you if you're solving the wrong problem for the wrong people.

item.title: The Authenticity Rebellion: Resisting the AI Echo Chamber
item.description: The internet is drowning in AI-generated content, but connection and creativity are drowning with it. This post explores why scaling your voice doesn't mean outsourcing your soul—and how to reclaim meaning, resonance, and trust in an age of auto-everything.

item.title: The Apple Ruling: A Win That Might Hurt More Than Help
item.description: Everyone's celebrating the DOJ's ruling against Apple as a victory for developers—until you realize the hidden costs of off‑platform payments.

item.title: Most Startups Don't Have a Growth Problem—They Have a Clarity Problem
item.description: Growth might be your dashboard's favorite metric, but it's not your startup's biggest obstacle. More often, the real issue is fuzziness—about your customer, your message, your purpose. This post breaks down why clarity, not velocity, is the foundation for real traction.

item.title: The Startup Bargain Is Broken
item.description: The startup ecosystem promised a tradeoff: take below-market pay, bet on equity, win big at IPO. That promise is unraveling—and it's time we reckon with what that means for talent, trust, and the future of innovation.

item.title: The Startup Reality Check: Payment, Promotion, and Pace
item.description: A blunt field guide for early-stage founders: why cash is your only true validator, marketing matters more than code, and slow shipping is the fast lane to failure.

item.title: The Agreement Trap: When AI Optimizes for Applause Instead of Accuracy
item.description: What happens when AI systems are rewarded for being agreeable rather than correct? Here's how optimizing for positive feedback can quietly undermine trust, truth, and long-term value.

item.title: The Accountability Mirror: Would a Stranger Believe You?
item.description: A gut-check on whether your habits actually align with the ambitions you say out loud—and what to do if they don’t.

item.title: The Founder Pay Gap: Why VCs Undercompensate the CEOs Who Built the Company
item.description: After year four, founder CEOs are paid like caretakers—while hired CEOs are paid like kings. Here’s why the cap table math is broken, and what we can do about it.
